Technical description:
For each office:document-styles/office:master-styles/style:master-page are created a file headerX.xml, footerX.xml, _rels/headerX.xml.rels, _rels/footerX.xml.rels.
The content of headerX.xml and footerX.xml are generated like document.xml and _rels/headerX.xml.rels, _rels/footerX.xml.rels contains relations for images and hyperlinks.
"Odd and even page" are checked if there are a style with : $style1/@style:name =  $style2/@style:next-style-name and $style1/@style:next-style-name = $style2/@style:name. It's the tag w:settings/w:evenAndOddHeaders.
If there are not odd and even page, the master style used is "Standard".
"Different first page" are checked if the style "First page" is used.  It's the tag w:document/w:body/w:sectPr/w:titlePg
Remarks/Questions:
There are  a different first page in OOX only if the style "first page" is used in ODF.
If there are many odd and even page, only one is kept and odd and even pages may be inverted.
header and footer belong to the page style!

style:font-face/@style:font-picth is converted to w:fonts/w:font/w:pitch

Sub Feature: Common Data Style Child Element Attributes

Technical description:
text:notes-configuration/@text:note-class attribute discriminates between footnotes and endnotes. This is required in OOX. 
Footnotes :
text:notes-configuration gives birth to two OOX styles named : 
concat(@text:note-class, 'Reference') and concat(@text:note-class, 'Text')
Both are defined w:semiHidden and w:unhideWhenUsed. 
The first one is based on @text:citation-body-style-name and the other on @text:citation-style-name.
The main use of text:notes-configuration is its translation to w:footnotePr (footnote properties) when @text:note-class is 'footnote' or w:endnotePr for 'endnote'.
Let's assume we are configuring footnotes.
- @text:start-value is translated to w:footnotePr/w:numStart/@w:val
- @style:num-format translates to w:footnotePr/w:numFmt using num-format template (already used for lists)
- @text:start-numbering-at translates to w:footnotePr/w:numRestart with the following mapping :
   - 'page' - > 'eachPage'
  - 'chapter' -> 'eachSect'
  - otherwise value is set to 'continuous'
- @text:footnotes-position is converted to w:footnotePr/w:pos/@w:val with the following mapping : 
  - 'text' -> 'beneathText'
  - otherwise 'pageBottom' value is set.
Remarks/Questions:
TODO : concerning footntes : handle master page, default note paragraph style, Footnote Continuation.
footnotes positions 'section' and 'document' don't seem to have counterpart in OOX.

Technical description: text:level translated to <w:lvl w:ilvl="{number(@text:level) - 1}">

text:display-number is involved in the generation of w:lvlText/@w:val format string. When display-number is encountered, "display-levels" template is recursively called until text:display-number has been reached.
style:num-format is translated to w:numFmt/@w:val as  :
1 -> decimal
i -> lowerRoman
I -> upperRoman
a -> lowerLetter
A -> upperLetter
otherwise decimal.
style:num-format may also be empty. In this case, it is translated to lvlText/@w:val = '' if  no text:display-number has been specified. Otherwise, numbering is skipped when "display-levels" is called on an empty num-format.
text:start-value is converted to w:start/@w:val

If fo:font-size is expressed in percentage of a parent font-size, we climb up the style ancestors until we find an absolute size (expressed in points). If none was found, the size of the default style (office:styles/style:default-style)  in the same family is used.
